intro: Isocoma acradenia, commonly known as desert horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Isocoma acradenia is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
